walkthroughs.title: Get started with Sourcery
walkthroughs.description: Your first steps to try out the powerful tools and features that the Sourcery extension has to offer!

steps.title: Get your first recommendation
steps.description:
Get started by opening our tutorial 
[Open tutorial](command:toSide:sourcery.welcome.open)
 Put the cursor over the underlined code to see the refactoring suggestion. 
 You can see all Sourcery's recommendations in the [Problems Pane](command:workbench.actions.view.problems)

steps.title: Accept your first recommendation
steps.description:
Put the cursor on an underline, then click the lightbulb or use the quick fix hotkey to show the code actions.
 Take the `Sourcery - Convert for loop into list comprehension` option to accept the change.

steps.title: Configure Sourcery to your needs.
steps.description:
Create a configuration file in your project to customise Sourcery.
[Create config file](command:toSide:sourcery.config.create)
A very useful setting to start with is the Python version, which lets you tell Sourcery which version you are using.

steps.title: Add custom rules
steps.description:
You can add your own custom rules to Sourcery!
Follow the tutorial to find out how.

steps.title: Enter your token
steps.description:
Get your free token to unlock all of Sourcery's features, including 30 days of Sourcery Pro
[Sign up for token](https://sourcery.ai/signup)
[Enter token](command:toSide:workbench.action.openSettings?"sourcery:")

steps.title: Advanced Features
steps.description:
Once you have entered your token you will be able to use Sourcery's Pro features for 30 days
These include:
Right click on a folder and choose 'Sourcery - Scan for refactorings'

 You can also try out 'Sourcery - Detect Clones' to find duplicate or near-duplicate code
To find out about our Team plan, including pre-commit hook and CLI:
[Open our documentation](https://docs.sourcery.ai/Plans/Sourcery-Team/)

commands.title: Create a default Sourcery configuration file for your project

sourcery.editor.title: Create Sourcery rule with this pattern

sourcery.token.description: Sourcery token. You can find your token at https://sourcery.ai/dashboard

scripts.vscode: npm run vscode:prepublish && VSCODE=$(which code-insiders || which code || echo echo ERROR: neither the code nor code-insiders vscode executable is installed); USER=dummy-dont-share-vscode-instance "$VSCODE" --user-data-dir=$PWD/.vscode-dev/user-data --verbose --extensionHomePath=$PWD/.vscode-dev/extensions --extensionDevelopmentPath=$PWD $*
